title: Collaborative Design Workshop for Self-Reflection Tools in Maker Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic maker education concepts, foundational UX design knowledge, and project management experience
context.additional_context: Enhancing collaborative tool development capabilities in multicultural and interdisciplinary settings

learning_goals: They complete a self-reflection tool design for maker education with over 80% fidelity by applying a collaborative design (co-design) process.
They acquire the competency to develop user-centered solutions aligned with the four UX design phases (analysis-design-prototype-evaluation).
They develop one prototype of a digital reflection tool that reflects the needs of multicultural learner groups.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
